intro: Lepanthes funerea, commonly known as the funeral orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically range in color from white to pale purple. The plant is epiphytic, meaning it grows on the surface of trees or other structures without deriving nutrients from them.
